greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of connected strict integer partitions of n with pairwise indivisible parts.
comment: Given a finite set S of positive integers greater than one, let G(S) be the simple labeled graph with vertex set S and edges between any two vertices with a common divisor. For example, G({6,14,15,35}) is a 4-cycle. A multiset S is said to be connected if G(S) is a connected graph.
example: The a(34) = 13 connected strict integer partitions with pairwise indivisible parts are (34), (18,16), (20,14), (22,12), (24,10), (26,8), (28,6), (30,4), (14,12,8), (15,10,9), (20,8,6), (14,10,6,4), (15,9,6,4). Their corresponding multiset multisystems (see A112798, A302242) are the following.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 17 2018
